title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 September 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:04 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
00:04 <rrodriguez> has quit

00:14 <vmassol> has quit

00:49 <vmassol> has quit

07:10 <vmassol> has quit  
07:13 <rrodriguez> has quit  
07:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <vmassol> has quit  
07:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:06 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <coud4> has quit  
08:21 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <jvelo> Hi guys  
09:57 <jvelo> tmortagne: xwiki-platform 4.2 fails to build on jenkins, xwiki-platform-extension-script cannot find extension-api tests jar  
09:58 <+tmortagne> jvelo: yes this is known but we don't know why  
09:58 <jvelo> I'm trying to understand why is that, but not too much clue  
09:58 <jvelo> ha  
09:58 <jvelo> so what can we do ?  
09:59 <vmassol> I'm debugging something ATM, when I'm done I can have a look but don't wait for me ;)  
09:59 <+tmortagne> I think Enygma worked on it yesterday but I don't know if he got something  
09:59 <+tmortagne> the quick fix is probable to make sur to build commons everywhere  
10:00 <+tmortagne> but we need to find and fix the real issue  
10:00 <jvelo> is there a difference between <type>test-jar</type> and a tests classifier ?  
10:00 <+tmortagne> for some reason it looks like Maven have some issues with remote test jars  
10:02 <+tmortagne> jvelo: I guess <type>test-jar</type> has a stronger meaning but technically in our case I don't see much difference  
10:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <jvelo> interesting, when I build locally with the same flags as jenkins, building extension-script fails  
10:23 <jvelo> (flags are  mvn clean deploy -Plegacy,integration-tests -U -e)  
10:23 <jvelo> though my console output is different  
10:23 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <jvelo> it's an "Auth fail"  
10:24 <jvelo> http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=0yPZC4tz  
10:26 <+tmortagne> jvelo: it's not the same  
10:26 <+tmortagne> it's when deploying on maven.xwiki.org  
10:26 <jvelo> yes  
10:26 <+tmortagne> you probably don't have your ssh key on there or something like this  
10:26 <jvelo> indeed  
10:27 <+tmortagne> you should try with install instead or deploy  
10:27 <+tmortagne> in jenkins case anything it fail before the install/deploy phase  
10:27 <+tmortagne> s/anything/anyway/  
10:33 <jvelo> right  
10:33 <jvelo> well build fine locally  
10:35 <+tmortagne> jvelo: did you had commons in your local repository ?  
10:36 <jvelo> yes  
10:36 <jvelo> trying without  
10:37 <+tmortagne> it seems to be the issue for jenkins agent  
10:40 <jvelo> works fine as well  
10:40 <jvelo> Downloaded: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public-snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-extension-api/4.2-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-commons-extension-api-4.2-20120926.165858-137-tests.jar  
10:56 <qwebirc65248> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <qwebirc65248> Hi all, please is there some way how to comment in sourcode of wikipage? I mean standart comments like # in bash or // in C++ or Java. Thanks  
10:59 <qwebirc65248> most nearest thing seems to be http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Comment+Macro  
11:00 <+tmortagne> qwebirc65248: there is no comment syntax so yes you have to use a macro  
11:00 <+tmortagne> I mean for xwiki/\* syntaxes  
11:01 <qwebirc65248> and is there some plan to implement those?  
11:01 <qwebirc65248> anyway thanks for help!!  
11:03 <+tmortagne> not in the near future  
11:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <cjd\_> has quit  
11:29 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <cjd\_> has quit  
11:44 <jvelo> I'm not sure what to try next, re the build issue  
11:49 <+tmortagne> I would say trying:  
11:49 <+tmortagne> \* making sure to build commons at least once on all agents  
11:49 <+tmortagne> \* trying to build platform by hand on the agent(s) where it's failing  
11:50 <jvelo> tmortagne: OK  
11:50 <+tmortagne> actually commons 4.2 probably already exist pretty much everywhere  
11:51 <+tmortagne> I could understand for 4.3 but 4.2 should work as it always did  
11:52 <+tmortagne> what is KVM-Agent-CentOS-GUI supposed to be ?  
11:53 <+tmortagne> I see it in the list of agents  
11:53 <jvelo> tmortagne: how do I find out hostnames of agents ?  
11:53 <+tmortagne> and platform-4.2 seems to usually build on it  
11:53 <+tmortagne> supposed to be agent-\*.maven.xwiki.org  
11:53 <+tmortagne> but for this one I have no idea  
11:54 <jvelo> I've seen platform-4.2 fail on other agents than the KVM  
11:54 <+tmortagne> will try to make it build on agent1  
11:54 <jvelo> seems my key isn't copied on agents  
11:55 <+tmortagne> try from maven.xwiki.org  
11:55 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <jvelo> with which user ?  
11:56 <jvelo> (trying [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) but I'm refused)  
11:56 <+tmortagne> that's the right user  
11:56 <+tmortagne> bu your key is probably not there  
11:57 <+tmortagne> try to access maven.xwiki.org and then go to agent-1 from there  
11:57 <jvelo> I try from maven  
11:57 <+tmortagne> that's weird then  
11:58 <+tmortagne> what user do you use on maven.xwiki.org ?  
11:58 <+tmortagne> maven ?  
11:58 <+tmortagne> works well for me  
11:58 <+tmortagne> you are probably not logged with maven user on maven.xwiki.org  
11:58 <jvelo> ok works with user maven  
11:58 <jvelo> I was trying with my user  
11:58 <jvelo> thanks  
11:59 <+tmortagne> platform is running on agent-1  
11:59 <+tmortagne> lets see how it goes  
12:00 <jvelo> so there's no xwiki-commons-extension-api/4.2-SNAPSHOT on agent-1  
12:00 <jvelo> only 4.3-SNAPSHOT/  
12:03 <+tmortagne> would mean commons 4.2 has never been built on agent-1 which sounds a bit weird but why not  
12:04 <+tmortagne> commons or anything depending on it actually  
12:04 <jvelo> it's on agent-2  
12:04 <jvelo> so if it fails we can try there  
12:07 <jvelo> it's on 3 too. not on 4,5,6 and 7&8 I can't connect  
12:07 <+tmortagne> 7 and 8 are windows servers  
12:08 <jvelo> ok  
12:24 <jvelo> tmortagne: It failed  
12:24 <+tmortagne> jvelo: ok  
12:24 <+tmortagne> trying by hand on the egent  
12:24 <jvelo> how do you start a build on a specific agent ?  
12:24 <+tmortagne> agent  
12:24 <jvelo> (I'd like to try on agent2)  
12:25 <+tmortagne> the only way I know if to change the configuration of the job to tied it to an agent and then start it  
12:25 <jvelo> ok  
12:26 <+tmortagne> but would be nice to have something easier since we have to do that pretty often  
12:26 <+tmortagne> maybe a plugin  
12:26 <+tmortagne> or something I did not see  
12:27 <jvelo> it's "Restrict where this project can be run" ?  
12:27 <jvelo> looks like it  
12:27 <+sburjan> it seems that I found a strange bug on oracle. reporting it now  
12:28 <+sburjan> dunno if this is considered a blocker, someone will have to take a look at it  
12:28 <+tmortagne> at least I can reproduce directly on the agent  
12:28 <+tmortagne> jvelo: yes  
12:36 <qwebirc65248> has quit  
13:02 <+sburjan> Denis, tmortagne, vmassol : I am not able to say if this is a blocker. Could you please take a look ? http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8258  
13:03 <mflorea> has quit  
13:06 <+sburjan> there is also this: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8259  
13:07 <vmassol> sburjan: it's indeed some blockers that we need to report in the release notes, but I don't think we should stop the release, insted we need to work on fixing it for 4.2.1  
13:07 <vmassol> good catch  
13:07 <+sburjan> ok, so should i mark them as blockers ?  
13:08 <vmassol> yes  
13:08 <+sburjan> thanks :)  
13:10 <polx> has quit  
13:13 <+sburjan> gonna check this for postgres too  
13:14 <vmassol> tmortagne, sburjan: does the warning look good to you: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise42RC1 ?  
13:15 <vmassol> sburjan: a pity we didn't check for oracle/postgres earlier  
13:16 <+sburjan> vmassol: yes :(  
13:16 <+sburjan> vmassol: the message is pretty clear for end users IMO  
13:17 <+sburjan> vmassol: maybe these are the hidden oracle issues you told me about, exposed by the DW  
13:18 <jvelo> tmortagne: looks good on agent-2. extension-script has build successfully  
13:19 <vmassol> jvelo: I'm not sure that miscellaneous should be under Developer. There are some for end users and some for developers  
13:19 <jvelo> vmassol: I've followed the template  
13:20 <jvelo> but indeed  
13:20 <vmassol> you've merged  
13:20 <jvelo> it looked odd  
13:20 <vmassol> and I'm pretty sure  
13:20 <vmassol>  that i have put some misc for users  
13:20 <vmassol> in past release notes  
13:20 <jvelo> yes but I've merged following the template  
13:20 <vmassol> the template doesn't specify this  
13:20 <jvelo> the one linked to from release plan  
13:20 <jvelo> maybe I did a mistake  
13:21 <vmassol> fixing template to make it more easy to understan  
13:21 <vmassol> it's wrong in several places  
13:21 <vmassol> Translations have nothing to do for developers  
13:22 <jvelo> vmassol: moving the misc up in users  
13:22 <vmassol> only for non dev stuff  
13:22 <vmassol> dev stuff should remain under dev  
13:23 <jvelo> yep  
13:23 <vmassol> jvelo: wdyt of this new template: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/ReleaseNoteTemplate ?  
13:24 <jvelo> looks good  
13:24 <jvelo> I'll move dev misc under upgrades for 4.2  
13:24 <jvelo> to follow this  
13:24 <vmassol> thanks  
13:25 <vmassol> I'll remove "and Important Bug Fixes"  
13:25 <vmassol> done  
13:25 <vmassol> so we have the same title for non dev and for dev stuff  
13:25 <vmassol> and it's up to us to decide if we put important bug fixes or not in there too  
13:26 <vmassol> usually we don't but if we consider some bug to be important to be written we can do so  
13:26 <+sburjan> vmassol: psql is okay !  
13:27 <vmassol> xool  
13:27 <vmassol> cool  
13:48 <sdumitriu> has quit  
13:58 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:58 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <polx> has quit  
14:14 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:20 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <jvelo> tmortagne: you think there is a chance the platform build issue happens when releasing or I can go ahead?  
14:46 <+tmortagne> jvelo: I doubt you will have the issue since you will have everything in your local repository  
14:47 <jvelo> ok, it uses local artifacts  
14:47 <jvelo> onward, then  
14:47 <mflorea> has quit  
15:00 <jvelo> guys, Enygma` : I can't find the release-translations.sh in agent-1 home  
15:01 <jvelo> nevermind  
15:01 <jvelo> found it  
15:08 <jvelo> I will need some git help  
15:08 <jvelo> the release-translations.sh script fails with http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=XE2C5KLX  
15:08 <jvelo> I don't want to mess up everything :)  
15:08 <jvelo> maybe a "git fetch -a" before ?  
15:10 <jvelo> trying this  
15:11 <+tmortagne> jvelo: that's because when the script execute git pull git does ont know where it's supposed to pull  
15:11 <+tmortagne> because it's a new branch not listed in the configuration  
15:11 <jvelo> yes  
15:11 <jvelo> that's why I try fetch all  
15:11 <+tmortagne> basically you have to do what is indicated  
15:11 <+tmortagne> fetch will not help  
15:11 <jvelo> ok, I need to edit the config  
15:11 <+tmortagne> yep  
15:11 <+tmortagne> there is maybe a command to at it to the configuration but I don't know it  
15:12 <+tmortagne> I don't understand why it's not done automatically when you checkout the first time  
15:12 <+tmortagne> s/to at/to do/  
15:16 <jvelo> I think if you have fetched the remote branches, their is automatic tracking when you switch to a branch of the same name as the remote one  
15:16 <jvelo> that's why I wanted to try fecth  
15:19 <jvdrean> has quit  
15:20 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <+tmortagne> jvelo: I don't understand you can't checkout a branch you did not fetched  
15:27 <jvelo> you can, it will be a local branch. But the automatic tracking will mean that if you do git pull this\_branch it will pull from the remote  
15:27 <jvelo> well that's what I understand, I might be off :)  
15:27 <+tmortagne> jvelo: you can't checkout on a branch that does not exists  
15:27 <+tmortagne> you can if you create it  
15:27 <jvelo> checkout -b  
15:27 <jvelo> yes it creates it  
15:27 <+tmortagne> -b means you create it  
15:28 <jvelo> sure  
15:28 <+tmortagne> it's just a shortcut  
15:28 <+tmortagne> I checkouted remote branched many time and it's never added to the configuration automatically  
15:29 <+tmortagne> not with a simple checkout at least  
15:29 <jvelo> did you fetch the branch before ?  
15:30 <jvelo> anyways  
15:30 <+tmortagne> jvelo: of course, how would have switched to it otherwise ?  
15:30 <jvelo> we are talking about two different things  
15:31 <jvelo> you talk about switching to a remote branch, I'm talking about creating/switching to a local branch with the same name as a remote that you've fetch  
15:31 <+tmortagne> no i'm not  
15:31 <jvelo> but as I said I might be wrong  
15:31 <+tmortagne> I'm talkinga about "git checkout somebranch"  
15:31 <+tmortagne> which create and switch to a local branch names after the origin one  
15:31 <+tmortagne> automaticlaly  
15:32 <+tmortagne> s/names/named/  
15:32 <+tmortagne> actually I think it's added to the configuration when you do like this  
15:33 <+tmortagne> it's not when you do the opposite  
15:33 <+tmortagne> pushing directly a local branch  
15:33 <+tmortagne> ho did you created the stable-4.2.x branch ?  
15:33 <+tmortagne> how  
15:34 <jvelo> hum actually it seems there is a setting for that : git config branch.autosetupmerge true  
15:34 <jvelo> tmortagne: I've configured tracking manually in .git/confnig  
15:34 <jvelo> tmortagne: I have a lot of formatting changes in translations files  
15:34 <jvelo> this is due to changes in the XAR export ?  
15:35 <+tmortagne> you have to execute mvn xar:format  
15:35 <+tmortagne> to "normalize" all that  
15:36 <+tmortagne> we have special formating of XAR pages on git but the export does not apply this formating  
15:36 <jvelo> ok  
15:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <+tmortagne> we should probably update the export plugin with this new formatting  
15:36 <+tmortagne> update XWikiDocument#toXML actually  
15:37 <jvelo> OK, remains just change from <hidden>true</hidden> to <hidden>false</hidden>  
15:38 <jvelo> those are legitimate I guess ?  
15:38 <jvelo> jvdrean: ?  
15:39 <jvelo> (I think you've worked on hidden docs recently)  
15:39 <jvelo> those are about translations files  
15:39 <vmassol> indeed translation files should be hidden  
15:40 <vmassol> <hidden>true  
15:40 <jvelo> OK  
15:40 <jvelo> the export script should ensure that, on l10n ?  
15:40 <vmassol> yep it should, something to update in the release plan ATM till it does this  
15:40 <vmassol> good you caught it  
15:42 <jvelo> there hasn't been any new translations since RC1, for the moment I could just checkout -- everything I guess  
15:43 <+tmortagne> we need to modify l10n pour set hidden to true instead of the script  
15:45 <+Enygma`> jvelo: the problem you have in release-translations.sh seems to be located in this method: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-release-scripts/blob/master/staged/release-translations.sh#L55  
15:45 <+Enygma`> the line "git pull || exit -1" should be "git pull origin ${BRANCH}|| exit -1" instead  
15:46 <jvelo> Enygma`: you mean the new bramch issue ?  
15:46 <jvelo> yep  
15:46 <+Enygma`> this way you should not get that message anymore  
15:46 <+Enygma`> git pull is too generic  
15:47 <+Enygma`> I guess this issue is specific to final and bugfix releases, when you are working on a branch that`s different from master  
15:48 <jvelo> Enygma`: haven't you forgot to push a commit from commons in the release repos on agent1 ?  
15:48 <jvelo> # Your branch is ahead of 'origin/master' by 1 commit.  
15:48 <+Enygma`> checking  
15:48 <jvelo>     [branch] Updating inter-project dependencies on master  
15:49 <jvelo> that should be pushed automatically I guess  
15:51 <jvelo> tmortagne: is using mvn xar:format is enforced for all wiki pages ?  
15:51 <jvelo> (I see a couple of modules where sources have the old formatP)  
15:52 <+tmortagne> jvelo: it's supposed to since it's checked when you buid  
15:52 <+tmortagne> what modules ?  
15:52 <jvelo> xwiki-platform-application-manager-ui  
15:53 <jvelo> and wiki-manager  
15:54 <jvelo> (their translation files at least)  
15:54 <jvelo> it seems the other files are ok  
15:55 <+tmortagne> jvelo: isn't because just just overwrite them ?  
15:55 <jvelo> no  
15:55 <jvelo> I was checking on github  
15:56 <+tmortagne> it's weird then since I don't think the xar plugin has options to exclude pages  
15:56 <jvelo> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-application-manager/xwiki-platform-application-manager-ui/src/main/resources/XAppResources/Translations.es.xml  
15:56 <jvelo> for instance  
15:56 <+Enygma`> jvelo: you`re right  
15:56 <jvelo> tmortagne: maybe their is an include rule pattern that is wrong  
15:56 <+Enygma`> but that commit should have been automatically pushed by the release script  
15:56 <+tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager-ui/src/main/resources/WikiResources/Translations.ca.xml is formated  
15:56 <+Enygma`> the stabilize\_branch method does the work but does not do any push: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-release-scripts/blob/master/maven-release.sh#L107  
15:56 <+tmortagne> so it does not seems to be all pages  
15:57 <jvelo> strange  
15:57 <+Enygma`> jvelo: however, that local commit needs to be discarded since I`ve fixed the problem on master already  
15:57 <jvelo> Enygma`: OK  
15:57 <jvelo> thanks  
15:58 <+tmortagne> jvelo: most of the pages seesm to be formated for wiki manager  
15:58 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <+tmortagne> if not all  
15:58 <jvelo> check application manager  
15:58 <jvelo> there are 26 not formatted  
15:58 <+tmortagne> ok but you said wiki-manager too  
15:58 <jvelo> yes I've seen some there  
15:59 <jvelo> I think  
15:59 <Slashman> hello everyone, I just installed xwiki via the deb package and I'm trying to log in, according to the documentation, the default admin user is "Admin" and its password is "admin", but it doesn't work, any idea?  
15:59 <jvelo> or maybe I was misled by the <hidden> changes  
15:59 <+tmortagne> I don't understand how it can build  
15:59 <jvelo> sorry for that if there aren't in wiki-manager  
15:59 <+tmortagne> it should fail on not formated pages  
16:00 <+tmortagne> I don't see anything in the pom.xml to skip the check  
16:00 <+tmortagne> Slashman: did you imported the XAR ?  
16:00 <jvelo> tmortagne: [INFO]   Verifying [XAppResources/Translations.es.xml]... ok  
16:00 <jvelo> so maybe something the check misses

16:04 <vmassol>  \* <ul>  
16:04 <vmassol>  \*   <li>ensure that pages all have a parent (except for Main.WebHome)</li>  
16:04 <vmassol>  \*   <li>ensure that the author/contentAuthor/creator is {@code xwiki:XWiki.Admin}</li>  
16:04 <vmassol>  \*   <li>ensure that the version is {@code 1.1}</li>

16:07 <vmassol>      \* @parameter expression="${pretty}"  
16:07 <vmassol>      \* @readonly  
16:07 <vmassol>      \*/  
16:07 <vmassol>     private boolean pretty = true;
